availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Samuel Staples being now in custody, charged with the offence of passing counterfeit treasury notes, or united states treasury notes, and being admitted to bail in the Sum of Five hundred Dollars, we James M Branch of the county of Trimble and hereby undertake that the above Samuel Staples Shall appear in the Trimble circuit court on the first day of its next May term, and render himself ameniable to the orders and processes of sd court, in the prosecution of sd charge, and if convicted Shall render himself in execution thereof, or if he failes in either we will pay the commonwealth Five hundred Dollars
Taken and subscribed before us as Justices of the peace for Trimble County this 18 day of March 1865.

John W Stewart J P T C
J H Lane J. P. T. C

A Copy attest
W. F. Peak, Clerk, T. Ct. C
